body.name: Upheaval: A Post-Apocalyptic Disaster Thriller (Fault Lines Book 1)
body.description: A catastrophic megaquake. An unforgiving tsunami. A family caught in the middle.Clint Redshaw walks into a port facility meeting expecting an ordinary day arguing about the budget. When the shaking starts, he keeps calm. But as the tremors stretch on and on, the ground rips apart, the dock disintegrates, and chunks of land fall into the Strait. When the quake finally ends, there’s only one thing on his mind: his daughter.Mika’s singing songs and laughing with a gaggle of other sixteen-year-olds as they climb into the Pacific Northwest mountains for a scout weekend. One minute it’s sunshine and good vibes and the next it’s screaming and chaos as a landslide careens down the mountainside, heading straight for the van.Daphne’s multiple floors up in a high-rise conference room when the water in her glass ripples. Four minutes later, everyone around her is dead or injured and she thinks she’s lucky to have survived. Little does she know, it’s only the beginning.With a wave of water about to inundate the greater Seattle metro, it’s a race against time to survive. Clint, Mika, and Daphne Redshaw dig deep to find their inner strength and courage to not only survive the big one, but find their way back to each other.Upheaval is book one in the Fault Lines series, an apocalyptic disaster thriller series following ordinary people struggling to survive when a megaquake plunges the Pacific Northwest into chaos.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Finished book one. Ready to start book two. I am acquainted with the main characters an look forward to more adventures.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Fault Lines book 1
reviews.reviewText: I’m a big fan of post apocalyptic disaster books, there are so many out there. You never know what to expect.This one was not full of any extremes, But it was pretty good , and I enjoyed it. I found that I liked the authors riding style very much, and it was easy to read. The story flowed smoothly, and it’s always a good thing when the main characters are likable and you find yourself rooting for them. Nice vivid descriptions of the damage created by the earth quakes and tsunami. I will read book too.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Fault Lines Book 1
reviews.reviewText: A devastating earth quake hits the west coast from near Canada all the way near California feels the quake, but the tsunami that follows is worse. An estranged family is caught up in the devastation. Is the father and daughter capable of finding the mother many miles away. It was a miracle the father and daughter survived, but they have to try to find her. Great characters, and the story grabs you from a few sentences in and its a terrifying read.Starting book 2 now.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewText: No spoilers. It was exciting to read the events unfold, but the story was too coincidental. I think I’ll pass on book 2.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I enjoyed this book a lot and I am looking forward to the next chapter! It would make a good movie!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Cascadia Fault earthquake
reviews.reviewText: Quite a story. This is not some zombie nonsense or yet another EMP attack. This is what will really happen one day. So far, it hasn't devolved into yet another cliche of how hordes of people turn evil while a small group of good but resourceful people mount a desperate fight to preserve decency.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Entertaining and makes you think
reviews.reviewText: This was a quick read. You can see the scenes playing out and kind of know what’s going to happen but she does a good job of keeping you invested in the story line. It’s pretty terrifying imaging what this would really be like and makes you think how you could better prepare 😬

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars upheaval a disaster thriller
reviews.reviewText: unfortunately I have already read this book. Was a good story but I do not want to reaad it again.

I would have given it 5 stars if the author mentioned what happened to Vancouver Island and the mainland after the quakes and tsunamis - I know the story is focused on Seattle and the U.S. west coast, but it would be nice, if someday, an author bothered to write what would happen in Canada as well. It is left up to my imagination for Canada.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on September 4, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I enjoyed the book,story and characters very believable.I would of liked it to be a bit longer but I can buy the next book.

A new author for me and I really enjoyed the three books in this series. Storyline was fast moving, with believable characters and lots of twists and turns. The premise is totally believable and the tsunami that then followed brought back the images we saw of the Banda Aceh tsunami and devastation. This is book one and leads easily into book two.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on August 19, 2023
reviews.reviewText: An absolutely gripping book that had me hooked right from the beginning. It's a compelling story and I hope it's not long until the next one is published. A brilliant read.
another good series. had me on the edge of my seat. Will hey gind Daphne alive. look forward to the next.
